text: {"answer": "C", "reasoning": "Statement i is true: Changing the use of a building in an agricultural zone (from restaurant to club room) constitutes a change of use (Nutzungsänderung) that requires approval under spatial planning law (RPG), especially since non-agricultural uses are restricted in such zones. Statement ii is false: Even temporary/mobile structures (Glaszimmer) anchored to the ground constitute buildings or installations (Bauten/Anlagen) under Swiss law. Their placement outside building zones (in unberührter Natur) is generally prohibited (Art. 16 RPG) and certainly requires a building permit, which would likely be denied. Therefore, only statement ii is false."}
